arm_group.description:
The subjects randomised to Treatment sequence 1  are going to test
Coloplast Adhesive baseplate A (A)
Coloplast Adhesive baseplate B (B)
SenSura 1-piece (S)
The subjects test the three test products in a randomised order: ABS; BSA; SAB

The subjects randomised to Treatment sequence 2  are going to test
Coloplast Adhesive baseplate B (B)
Coloplast Adhesive baseplate C (C)
SenSura 1-piece (S)
The subjects test the three test products in a randomised order: CBS; BSC; SCB

The subjects randomised to Treatment sequence 3  are going to test
Coloplast Adhesive baseplate A (A)
Coloplast Adhesive baseplate B (C)
SenSura 1-piece (S)
The subjects test the three test products in a randomised order: ACS; CSA; SAC

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the the current investigation is to develop new soft and more flexible 1-piece
      ostomy products.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Performance of New 1-piece Ostomy Product

group.description: baseline data was obtained on all subjects in the ITT population. Two subjects were not included in the ITT population as they were screen failures.
group.title: Overall Study Population

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

outcome.description:
The degree of leakage is measured using a 4-point leakage scale developed by Coloplast A/S at every baseplate change.
The subjects tick of one of the following choices:
No leakage
Starting to leak
Leakage
Sudden Leakage

measure.description:
The degree of leakage is measured using a 4-point leakage scale developed by Coloplast A/S at every baseplate change.
The subjects tick of one of the following choices:
No leakage
Starting to leak
Leakage
Sudden Leakage
measure.title: Degree of Leakage
measure.units: percentage of baseplates with no leakage

outcome.title: Degree of Leakage

group.description: The subjects first tested Coloplast test product A then Coloplast test product B and finally the comparator SenSura
group.title: Test A/Test B/SenSura

group.description: The subjects first tested Coloplast test product A then Coloplast test product C and finally the comparator SenSura
group.title: Test A/Test C/SenSura

group.description: The subjects first tested Coloplast test product B then SenSura and finally Coloplast test product A
group.title: Test B/SenSura/Test A

group.description: The subjects first tested Coloplast test product A then SenSura and finally Coloplast test product B
group.title: Test B/SenSura/Test C

group.description: The subjects first tested Coloplast test product C then Coloplast test product A and finally the comparator SenSura
group.title: Test C/Test B/SenSura

group.description: The subjects first tested Coloplast test product C then SenSura and finally Coloplast test product A
group.title: Test C/SenSura/Test A

group.description: The subjects first tested SenSura then Coloplast test product A and finally Coloplast test product B
group.title: SenSura/Test A/Test B

group.description: The subjects first tested SenSura then Coloplast test product A and finally Coloplast test product C
group.title: SenSura/Test A/Test C

group.description: The subjects first tested SenSura then Coloplast test product C and finally Coloplast test product B
group.title: SenSura/Test C/Test B

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment was performed primarily via Coloplast own subject database. In Norway recruitment also took place through medical clinics and hospitals.

event.sub_title: active colitis ulcerosa in remaining bowl

event.description: caused by a mountain bike accident
event.sub_title: skin injury on forehead and nose

reported_events.time_frame: The adverse events were collected during the investigation

detailed_description.textblock:
The present investigation aims at testing the degree of leakage with the new flexible
      1-piece ostomy products as well as other performance and safety parameters.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Have given written informed consent and signed letter of authority form.

          2. Be at least 18 years of age and have full legal capacity.

          3. Be able to handle the bags themselves.

          4. Have an ileostomy with a diameter between 15 and 40 mm.

          5. Have had their ostomy for at least three months.

          6. Currently use a 1-piece flat ostomy appliance with open bag.

          7. Use minimum 1 ostomy appliance every second day.

          8. Be suitable for participation in the investigation and for using standard adhesive,
             flat base plate.

          9. Must be able to use a custom cut ostomy appliance.

         10. Accept to test three 1-piece ostomy appliances in the investigation.

         11. Negative result of a pregnancy test for women of childbearing age (only DK).

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Use irrigation during the study (flush the stoma with water).

          2. Currently receiving or have within the past 2 months received radio- and/or
             chemotherapy.

          3. Currently receiving or have within the past months received local or systemic steroid
             treatment in the peristomal area.

          4. Are pregnant or breastfeeding.

          5. Participating in other interventional clinical investigations or have previously
             participated in this investigation.

          6. Currently using ostomy belt.

          7. Currently using extended wear product.

          8. Known hypersensitivity towards any of the test products

          9. Suffer from peristomal skin problems that preclude participation in the investigation
             (assessed by the investigation nurse) -

intervention.description: Coloplast Adhesive baseplate  A is a newly developed 1-piece ostomy appliance.
Coloplast Adhesive baseplate B is a newly developed 1-piece ostomy appliance
Coloplast Adhesive baseplate C is a newly developed 1-piece ostomy appliance
SenSura 1-piece is the commercial CE-marked Coloplast 1-piece SenSura .

clinical_study.official_title: Investigating the Safety and Performance of New 1-piece Ostomy Product Concepts Compared With SenSura 1-piece in Subjects With an Ileostomy

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: Danish Health and Medicines Authority

primary_outcome.description:
The degree of leakage is measured using a 4-point leakage scale developed by Coloplast A/S at every baseplate change.
The subjects tick of one of the following choices:
No leakage
Starting to leak
Leakage
Sudden Leakage
